https://doi.org/10.7927/H4WM1BB7.Description: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) Socio-Economic Baseline Dataset consists of population, human development, economic, water resources, land cover, land use, agriculture, food, energy, and biodiversity data.
https://doi.org/10.7927/H4WM1BB7.Project: IPCC - Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change

https://doi.org/10.7927/yzp7-sm30.Description: The INFORM (Index for Risk Management) Global Risk Index identifies the countries at a high risk of humanitarian crisis that are more likely to require international assistance. These data may be helpful in environmental justice research.
https://doi.org/10.7927/yzp7-sm30.Project: IPCC - Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change

https://doi.org/10.7927/5bbs-e174.Description: The Natural Resource Protection Indicator (NRPI) covers 135 countries and is calculated based on the weighted average percentage of biomes under protected status. The CHI is a composite index for 194 countries derived from the average of three proximity-to-target scores for access to at least basic water and sanitation along with child mortality.

https://doi.org/10.7927/k9t6-gh59.Description: The Global Development Potential Indices (DPIs) dataset contains thirteen sector-level DPIs for sectors related to renewable energy, concentrated solar power, photovoltaic solar, wind, hydropower, fossil fuels (coal, conventional and unconventional oil and gas), mining (metallic, non-metallic), and agriculture (crop, biofuels) The DPI for each sector represents land suitability that accounts for both resource potential and development feasibility.

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4K64G12.Description: The Poverty Mapping Project: Global Subnational Prevalence of Child Malnutrition dataset consists of estimates of the percentage of underweight children across the globe. These data may aid in poverty and food insecurity research.

https://dx.doi.org/10.7927/H45X26V8.Description: The Poverty Mapping Project: Unsatisfied Basic Needs data set consists of measures of household level well-being and access to basic needs, such as adequate housing conditions, water, electricity, sanitation, education, and employment, for subnational administrative units of numerous countries in Latin America.
https://dx.doi.org/10.7927/H45X26V8.Geographic_Coverage: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Mexico, Nicaragua, Peru

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4PZ56R2.Description: The Poverty Mapping Project: Global Subnational Infant Mortality Rates data set consists of estimates of infant mortality rates for the year 2000. The infant mortality rate for a region or country is defined as the number of children who die before their first birthday for every 1,000 live births.
